content.text:
# Draft:Warda Howard

]]Warda Howard was an American actress on stage and screen. She "headed" a "dramatic company" that toured the Far East for two years.
She was in V.L.S.E. films.
(VLSE was "established and controlled by Vitagraph Company of America, Lubin Manufacturing Company, Selig Polyscope Company, and Essanay Film Manufacturing Company. It was a distribution alternative to the General Film Company."
She portrayed a young streetwalker in Jamboree by Bessie Beatty and Jack Black.
Fimography
*The Longer Voyage (1915, a leading role with Sydney Ainsworth)
*The Raven (1915)
*The Little Girl Next Door (1916)
*That Sort (1916), as Diana Laska, a starring role
*Lying Lips (1916) she was in it as Eugenie Forde or a character in it was named Wanda Howard?
Theater
*Red Light Annie (1923) as Dorothy Martin
*Jamboree (1932) as Marguerite
References
